subject: Travel
title: Silk: The Fabric of Empires
description: A quick, practical guide to Silk: The Fabric of Empires.

hook.text: Roman senators wore Chinese silk without knowing where it came from or how it was made.

buildup.text: China kept silk production secret for 3,000 years. Revealing the process was punishable by death.

discovery.text: Silk comes from the cocoon of the Bombyx mori moth. One cocoon yields a single thread a mile long.

twist.text: Rome's silk addiction drained so much gold eastward that the Senate tried to ban the fabric.

climax.text: The ban failed. Roman women refused to give up silk, calling wool barbaric in comparison.

punchline.text: A caterpillar's thread nearly bankrupted Rome.

quiz.question: Why did the Roman Senate try to ban silk?
